column1: Art Institute of Chicago////One criticism though is that the informational placards next to some of the paintings were really tiny. I mean
column2: I understand that you don't want to take away from the paintings with these huge signs of text
column3: but think about your audience. While the museum is popular among younger people with 20/20 vision
column4: it is also popular among old people who - let's face it - can't see that well. I think it would help if the placards with a lot of text were a tad bit bigger. My mom
column6: had to get within inches of each sign to read it with her glasses. It was kind of ridiculous.
